author: Steve Stammers
title: Chelsea to let Diego Costa rot until end of transfer window if striker fails to accept he is not for sale
text:
Sport Chelsea to let Diego Costa rot until end of transfer window if striker fails to accept he is not for sale Costa is wanted by clubs in China but Roman Abramovich and Antonio Conte have agreed a stand must be made and Conte is willing to leave him out until the window is closed - before holding talks over his future Share Chelsea's Diego Costa looks dejected (Photo: PA) Share Get Chelsea FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Diego Costa will be left to rot if he fails to accept Chelsea’s decree that he is not for sale to any Chinese bidder. 
Chelsea owner Roman Abramovich and manager Antonio Conte agree a stand must be made to keep the Spain international at their club. 
If necessary Conte will leave Costa out of the Blues first team for the rest of the January transfer window before reviewing the player’s long term future. 
And senior Chelsea stars are telling Costa he should apologise to the club and back down. 
There are claims that Costa is reflecting on the club’s hardline stance and having to review his position. Diego Costa celebrates scoring earlier this season (Photo: Reuters) Diego Costa and Antonio Conte in happier times (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Despite not travelling with the team to Leicester he posted an Instagram message ‘Come on Chelsea’. 
The message was liked by Chelsea captain John Terry and Cesc Fabregas, two of the players who are trying to make Costa change his stance. poll loading Will Diego Costa leave for China this January? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
